Counterletter.definition: a secret agreement that expresses the true intent of the parties to a simulation ;esp
Counterletter.origin: [ can have no effects against third persons in good faith " Louisiana Civil Code "]

1.1: a secret agreement that expresses the true intent of the parties to a simulation

2.1: a writing embodying the agreement [ can have no effects against third persons in good faith "
2.note: An agreement stating that the conveyor of some land is still the owner, even though the other party has been given a bill of sale, is an example of a counterletter.
